name: jenkins

description.integration: Jenkins is an open source continuous integration (CI) server.

documentation:
# jenkins

Use the jenkins connector to perform various operations such as build job , get build history and more. To do this, you'll need to create a new  jenkins account. You can find the detailed instructions to create a jenkins account in the [jenkins  documentation](https://www.jenkins.io/doc/).

## Prerequisites

To use the jenkins connector, you need to have a jenkins account. If you don't have one, you can create a jenkins account at [login.jenkins.com](https://www.jenkins.io/doc/).

## Supported Authentication Methods

-   Domain name
-   Api Token
-   password

## Basic Operations

### job

-   Build Job
-   Delete Job
-   Get Last Successful Build
-   Get All Job info
-   Disable Job
-   Enable Job
-   Stop Last Build

ai_description.integration: The Jenkins activity allows automation workflows to interact with a Jenkins CI server, enabling tasks such as building, deleting, and managing jobs; it should be used when you need to automate CI processes, such as triggering builds, retrieving job information, or controlling job states, with operations like job.build, job.delete, job.getLastSuccessfulBuild, job.getAllJobInfo, job.disable, job.enable, and job.stopLastBuild.
